channel.title: Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare
channel.description: Recent content in Lecture Notes on MIT OpenCourseWare

item.title: lec1_appendix_e.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on neural voltage are measured with intacellular electrodes, neurons respond passively into small inputs, and a neuron is leaky integrator with a threshold.

item.title: lec12_hamilton.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on harmonic oscillator, dissipation, symmetric network, hamiltonian form, energy dissipation, and antisymmetric networks.

item.title: lec13_antisym.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on idealization of interaction between excitatory and inhibitory neuron, dendrodendritic connections between and granule (inhibitory) cells, and linear antisymmetric network.

item.title: lec14_excinh.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on two neural populations, minimax, multiple goals, synaptic interactions, matrix-vector notation, saddle function, and pseudo gradient.

item.title: lec18_pca.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on hebbiansynaptic plasticity enables perceptronsto perform principal component analysis, variance and covariance, principal components, maximizing parallel variance, minimizing perpendicular variance, and neural implementation.

item.title: lec18_vq.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on hypothesis: Hebbiansynaptic plasticity enables a perceptronto compute the mean of its preferred stimuli, sequence of data vectors, learn something about their structure, multivariate statistics, and neural network algorithms.

item.title: lec19_delta.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on supervised learning problem, delta rule, delta rule as gradient descent, and Hebb rule.

item.title: lec20_backprop.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on simple vs. multilayer perceptron, hidden layer problem, generalized delta rule, derivation as a gradient algoritihm, and sensitivity lemma.

item.title: lec20_pavlov.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on pavlov?s experiment, terminology, Hebb model, and multiple stimuli.

item.title: lec21_backprop2.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on steady state, recurrent backpropagation, sensitivity lemma, input as a function of output, and Jacobian matrix.

item.title: lec6_decisions.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on decision making, all-to-all inhibition, unconditional winner-take-all, differential modes are unstable, and one possible winner.

item.title: lec6_integrator.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on maximum operation.

item.title: lec6_selectivity.pdf
item.description: This resource includes information on lateral inhibition amplifies differences relative to commonalities, lateral inhibition regulates response selectivity by setting a dynamic threshold, and rectification vs. thresholding.
